Text saved: "Potentially Hazardous Asteroids" are a type of **asteroid**, which are rocks that fly through space. These asteroids can pass quite close to Earth, less than 7.5 million kilometres from our planet's path in space. NASA has created a map of 1,400 of these possibly dangerous asteroids, but it is not believed that any of them will be a danger in the next 100 years. NASA can watch these objects using technology that is already available, and they can also predict if there will be a possible hit. If an asteroid is going to hit, two ways to protect Earth could be launched.
